cv_text:
APPLICANT 2





	SUMMARY

	Seeking a challenging opportunity in a fast-paced and demanding environment; to utilize educational background, incorporate skills to meet the needs of your organization, to demonstrate the ability of creating innovative business solutions while maximizing quality, efficiency, and customer satisfaction.

	

	EDUCATION

	Bachelors of Science, Computer Science, Ramapo College of New Jersey (In Progress)

	

	

	EXPERIENCE

	

	Satellite Communications Operator					    2012 - 2017                              

	Company 1

	

	Provide communication services through multimillion dollar terminals to users across the world while providing the highest level of customer service to help with any troubleshooting issues that arise. Accountability at all times of equipment, personnel, as well as conducting daily inventories in preparation for rigorous inspections.

	Duties, Accomplishments and Related Skills:

	Directly mentor and train coworkers

	Held billet intended for higher enlisted and excelled

	Letter of Appreciation for volunteering

	3 Personal awards for initiative, doing work above pay grade

	

	Watch Repairmen, Sales Representative		                         2011 - 2012

	Company 2 

	

	Dynamic position where needs of customers were always put first. Multi-tasking at all times balancing sales, customer service, and the repairing clients personal items while surpassing goals of the store from a customer satisfaction standpoint as well as financial.

	Duties, Accomplishments and Related Skills:

		Provide the highest level of customer service available to all customers 

		Attention to detail in fixing watches.

		Engaging customers to provide them their needs.

	

	Sales Leader, Customer Service Representative				    2010 - 2011

	Company 3

	

	Family owned business where customer experience is key to maintaining steady flow of business and directly up revenue. Building relations with clients, while mentoring new employees on proper sales and customer service etiquette. Handled all marketing, and advertising needs as well as creating and maintaining schedules for all employees.

	Duties, Accomplishments and Related Skills:

	Trained new employees once hired on store goals as well as sales.

	Interact with customers to gain the right to earn their business.

	Directly in charge of store marketing and advertising.

	Consistently achieved and surpassed store goals 

	

	Areas of Expertise:

	Customer Service Driven, Time and Personnel Management, Efficient Administrative Abilities, Ambitious, Innovative, Intelligent Oral Expression, Microsoft Office Applications, Attention to Detail, Client Relations, Critical Thinker

	

	

	References:

	Upon Request

Certified Nursing Assistant



I've done everything from customer service to Nursing Assistant and am interested in both fields.

Authorized to work in the US for any employer



WORK EXPERIENCE



Certified Nursing Assistant

Company 1  - September 2015 to August 2016

I aided a variety of individuals in multiple daily task.

Certified Nursing Assistant

Company 2  - March 2015 to June 2016

I provide quality Home Health Care to a variety of individuals.

	Certified Nursing Assistant	

Company 3 - Fayetteville, NC - February 2014 to February 2015

I provided quality care to elder residence within the facility.

Customer Service Associate

Company 4 - January 2012 to February 2014

My role as a Customer Service Associate was to make sure each and every customers needs where met so

that they always left with a smile on their face.

Crew Member

Company 5  - May 2011 to January 2012

My role as a McDonalds Crew Member consisted of making sure each customer recieved the correct orders

and that their meals were fresh and prepped neatly. I was also responsible for

stocking and sanitation within the restaurant.



EDUCATION



Physical Therapy

Fayetteville Technical Community College - Fayetteville, NC

2016 to 2018



SKILLS



Excellent Communication Skills (6 years), Excellent Customer Service Skills (6 years), Multi-Tasking (6

years), Certified Nursing Assistant (3 years), Team Player (6 years), Quick Learner (6 years), Ability to

produce quality work no matter the quantity. (6 years), I'm extremely reliable when it comes to work (6 years)



CERTIFICATIONS



Certified Nursing Assistant

April 2014 to April 2016

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION

I love working!

cv_text:
APPLICANT 4









SUMMARY



Motivated individual with background in retail store environment employed as a stock clerk.  Punctual and responsible with high ambition to seek challenges within the work environment; well-liked by co-workers and supervisors, work well with a team, and am always willing to assist others with a variety of  other job tasks; current in computer technology with strong organizational skills; seeking a position to apply my skills, experience and commitment to job excellence.





SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS



Computer technology skills include Microsoft Word and Excel; Internet research and Email setups

Strong customer service skills and experience

Effective speaking and writing communication skills

Multi-tasking skills - ability to prioritize assignments and meet deadlines

Excellent organizational skills; excellent record keeping and filing skills

Knowledgeable in Marketing techniques 

Experienced in organizing and displaying merchandise in a popular retail store setting

Work well within a team setting

Challenged to learn new tasks with a positive attitude





EMPLOYMENT



Company 1, Greensboro, NC						                                   07/2014 – 01/2015

Stock Clerk

Fold, steam items for setting up clothing and accessories displays

Attach sensors to clothing and accessories items before placing in retail store

Monitor merchandise for retail store to ensure all sizes are fully stocked and displayed

Stock items in storage room and continuously ensure it is well-organized



Company 2, Durham, NC                                                                                                                     01/2016 – Present

Sales Associate

Assist customers with merchandise and transactions

Set-up the front of the store for new inventory

Keep front of the store nice and tidy



Company 3, Durham, NC                                                                                                                   02/2016 – Present

Sales Associate

Manage the furniture, assist customers with items from stock

Recover items and place them in their correct location

Work overnights to stock merchandise

Unpack the Delivery truck and neatly place them in the back room







EDUCATION



North Carolina Central University, Durham, NC						         08/2016 – Present

Majoring in Criminal Justice



Guilford Technical Community College, Greensboro, NC					                          08/2015

Completed General Studies transfer courses 



Walter Hines Page High School, Greensboro, NC			                                                08/2011 - 06/2015

Graduated high school diploma (concentration in Marketing)

cv_text:
APPLICANT 6



Qualifications



5.5 years experience in a call center for a major wireless company

 

12 years experience as a driver-routing/time management, product delivery, product maintenance, quality customer service, great communication skills, have many hours on the road in both rural areas and cities. Have experience in rehab of homes (painting, minor sheet rock repairs, lawn maintenance, debris removal, lock changes, boarding of broken windows, minor plumbing and other household maintenance). Cleaned homes for make ready sales and move ins



Experience



COMPANY 1: Tech Support/Sales and Service/Billing support

From: May 2012 to present

5.5 years experience in a call center for a major wireless company using multiple computer systems and multiple departments ( ATS Advanced tech support / Commitments dept. / Sales and Service ) helping customers with billing issues to solve any questions about charges plan details to find the perfect resolutions for that customer also walking customers thru tech issues using programs that the company provided to solve any issues of  multiple devices and manufactures 



COMPANY 2

From: 2004 to 2010

Job Duties;

Traveled the state of New Mexico, and lower half of Colorado, locating and securing homes for national Mortgage companies. Was also involved in the rehab of homes ( painting, lawn maintenance, minor plumbing, other household maintenance. )..Cleaned homes for make ready sales and move ins.



COMPANY 3

From: 2003 to 2004

Job Duties; 

Traveled the Southern half of the state of California locating and securing homes for national Mortgage companies in both rural areas and cities. Was also involved in the rehab of homes (painting, lawn maintenance, minor plumbing, and other household maintenance.) Cleaned homes for make ready sales and move inns.



COMPANY 4

From: 1997 to 1999

Job Duties;

Worked as a labor for the first 3 months;(sanding, taping, clean up, and loading paint) than got promoted to lead painter overseeing a group of 12 delegating tasks and running equipment.



COMPANY 5: Driver 

From: 1993 to 1997

Job Duties;

4 years driving for XXX (furniture store) out of Texas;

Delivered and set up any merchandise as needed, performed maintenance on all merchandise,

De-escalated customer complaints.



Education



March 10, 1995 obtained GED from Region 16 education service center of Amarillo, Texas.





References Available Upon Request

cv_text:
APPLICANT 7

 

Education

Associate

Degree Name: Associate of Arts
Degree Status: Now Attending
Graduation Date: 06/2017
School Name: Central Carolina Community College

Country: USA
State: NC
Major: Business Administration



Licenses, Certifications and Clearance

Paralegal



Work Experience



COMPANY 1

Job Title: CUSTOMER SERVICE REP

Current Employer: No
Start Date: 05/2015
End Date: 12/2016


Responsibilities and Qualifications:
Interacts with 75+ customers over the phone daily. Actively listens to customer issues or questions, displaying compassion and empathy for the caller's situation. Processes billing requests, policy changes that do not require a license, resolves customer concerns and documents customer's requests. Ensure facilitation of first call resolution and customer satisfaction on all transactions. Acknowledge and direct customer's requests for additional products or services. Handle requests regarding required documentation and clearly explain any need for follow up on the customer's part.


Reason for Leaving:
Relocated



COMPANY 2

Job Title: Bank Teller

Current Employer: No
Start Date: 07/2014
End Date: 04/2015


Responsibilities and Qualifications:
● Provides account services to customers by receiving deposits and loan payments; cashing checks; issuing savings withdrawals; recording night and mail deposits; selling cashier's checks, traveler's checks, and series e bonds; answering questions in person or on telephone; referring to other bank services. ● Records transactions by logging cashier's checks, traveler's checks, and other special services; preparing currency transaction reports. ● Cross-sells bank products by answering inquiries; informing customers of new services and product promotions; ascertaining customers' needs; directing customers to a branch representative. ● Reconciles cash drawer by proving cash transactions; counting and packaging currency and coins; reconciling loan coupons and other transactions; turning in excess cash and mutilated currency to head teller; maintaining supply of cash and currency. ● Complies with bank operations and security procedures by participating in all dual-control functions; maintaining customer traffic surveys; auditing other tellers' currency; assisting in certification of proof. ● Maintains customer confidence and protects bank operations by keeping information confidential. ● Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed.


Reason for Leaving:
Was offered a full time position with another company.



COMPANY 3

Job Title: Paralegal Specialist

Current Employer: Yes
Start Date: 11/2012
End Date: 


Responsibilities and Qualifications:
Provides legal and administrative support in all areas of criminal law, international law, civil/administration law, contract law and fiscal law. Assists judges, Judge Advocates and unit commanders with a wide range of legal matters and judicial work. Provides legal documents in courts-martial, Article 15 actions, and other military justice matters. Review line of duty determinations, AR 15-6 investigations, separation board proceedings, and other administrative law matters. Assistance in family law such as powers of attorney, wills, and separation decrees.


Reason for Leaving:

cv_text:
APPLICANT 8





SUMMARY



As a young individual, I chose to work constantly on developing myself. The way I take care of myself reflects on how I can take care of YOU and YOUR company. I do many things to improve myself everyday including exercising, learning music, going to school. As I take care of myself every day, I will continue to develop your company and make it the best it can be if you let me. 



I plan to provide:

•Excellent customer service

•A drama free environment

• Excelling at what I am required to do

• The ability to master what I know and learn what I don't at a relentless rate.

• To be hungry for more

• Make my employer look even better towards their own boss.

• Help others to succeed

• Work weekends and hours that others won't be inclined to.

• Bring in even more business

• Deal with difficult customers effectively and efficiently

• Create an even better environment for my coworkers

• Help others

• Be a fast and productive worker• Completely drug free. So no smoke breaks!

Authorized to work in the US for any employer 





WORK EXPERIENCE

 

91B Wheeled Vehicle Mechanic 

Company 1 – 01/2017 to Present 



After recently coming out of Basic training and A.I.T. I serve once a month in the army reserves as a wheeled vehicle mechanic.



Customer Service Representative 

Company 2 – 11/2014 to 11/2015 

 I started off as a cashier in the front and quickly progressed into a photo specialist. As a cashier at the front, I had to maintain security, handle stressed customers because of the holidays, maintain a professional yet firm personality, vacuum, face everything and take out trash. As a Photo specialist, I currently take care of internet, store and send out photo orders. I also have to stock items, mop floors, record cooler and freezer temperatures, sweep, help other associates, count money for managers, Face the store, act as security, stock cooler and freezer, put away go-backs, while being a cashier. 



Server/Waiter/ Cashier/Retail Associate

Company 3  – 12/2015 to Present



As of now this is my current civilian job. I serve food to guests while maintaining a professional attitude. When I am not serving I am in the gift job doing cashier work, merchandising, working truck, and offering assistance to guests. 



Server, Busser 

Company 4  – 08/2014 to 11/2014 



I started off as a Busser and then got promoted to a Server. I quickly learned the importance of customer service in a fast paced environment. I would be running around all the time to get the customers their order. As a Busser I would clean tables, get people their drinks, and clean the floors daily. When I was promoted to a 

Server, I got the opportunity to work as a cashier and take orders while developing a charismatic personality. I would often be the first one to work and the last one to leave. 



EDUCATION 

91B Certification in Mechanic 

Advanced Infantry Training - 91B - Fort Lee, VA January 2016 to June 2016 

Associate in Computer Science 

Central New Mexico Community College - January 2014 to December 2015 

High School Diploma 

Cibola High School May 2014 

Albuquerque, NM 



SKILLS

Mechanic (1 year), Customer Service (3 years), Server (1 year) 

MILITARY SERVICE 

Service Country: United States 

Branch: US Army

Rank: E-2

December 2016 to Present 



CERTIFICATIONS/LICENSES 

609 Certification

APPLICANT 9

	

	

	SUMMARY OF QUALIFICATIONS

	

	

	+ yrs of Customer Service Experience

	2+ yrs of Technical Advisory Experience

2+ yrs of Supervisory Experience

	Excellent Oral and Written Communication Skills

	Proficient in Microsoft Excel, Word & PowerPoint

	Quick Learner w/Attention to Detail

	

	



WORK EXPERIENCE



Debt collector - Company 1                                                                                                            May 2017 - Present

Assist clients with resolving ingoing accounts 

Follow all guidelines and laws mandated by the state and federal government

Collect on past due accounts purchased

Update information as needed including phone number and address

Notate account financial status and collection efforts

		

			Tier II Senior Technical Advisor – Company 2	Jun 2014 - July 2016

				Listening to and understand customer issues by asking questions and isolating the issues and/cause 

	Utilizing available resources to identify appropriate solutions for customers;  

	Explaining product features and benefits, answering questions and setting proper expectations for customer inquiries; 

	Supervise direct reports to ensure they are achieving great customer satisfaction through effective call methods, training, and resolutions techniques; and 

	Identify and escalate emerging product or customer dissatisfaction issues to next level of management.

		

			Member Service Specialist – Company 3                                                                                             06/2012 – 05/2014

				Provided excellent customer service to customers; 

				Received, responded to, and directed member phone calls;

				Addressed member inquiries, questions and concerns regarding enrollment, claims, benefit interpretation, and referrals/authorizations for medical care; and

				Provided available information upon request and escalated issues as appropriate.

		

		Family Service Director – Company 4                                                                                                 06/2011 – 06/2012

		Offered counsel and comfort to bereaved families and friends of deceased

		Arranged cemetery or graveside details; 

		Educated family’s about purchasing burial plots/property as well as provided information on cemetery service options, products, and merchandise; 

		Coordinated with funeral homes details such as time and place of services; and 

		Obtained all information required to complete legal documents. 

	

		Team Lead/Floor Support – Company 5   	02/2009 – 01/2011

	Managed a team of sales reps to work together to achieve best results; 

	Assisted with training of new team members; 

	Handled incoming customer service calls while maintaining high quality, achieving daily sales quota; and

	Worked all other duties as assigned.

					

		

		EDUCATION

		

	Business Management - Thomas Nelson Community College,  Hampton, Virginia

	HS Diploma - Bethel High School, Hampton, Virginia
